column1: The Vale of Narog was the valley of the swift-running River Narog cut southwards through West Beleriand from the rivers sources beneath Ered Wethrin in the north. For the first half of the rivers journey
column2: the Vale passed through the high moorlands west of Doriath
column3: through lands that were ruled from Nargothrond
column4: and past the field of Tumhalad where Nargothronds last battle was fought.

column1: As the river plunged into the rocky lands beneath Taur-en-Faroth
column2: its valley became much steeper and narrower
column3: until the river emerged to flow across the lowlands of West Beleriand and ran on to meet Sirion at Nan-tathren.
